org.apache.tephra.distributed

Interface ThriftClientProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientProvider, PooledClientProvider, SingleUseClientProvider, ThreadLocalClientProvider

    public interface ThriftClientProvider
    This interface is used to provide thrift tx service clients: there is only one (singleton) tx service per JVM, but many threads may use it concurrently. However, being a thrift client, it is not thread-safe. In order to avoid serializing all tx calls by synchronizing on the tx service client, we employ a pool of clients. But in different scenarios there are different strategies for pooling: If there are many short-lived threads, it is wise to have a shared pool between all threads. But if there are few long-lived threads, it may be better to have thread-local client for each thread. This interface provides an abstraction of the pooling strategy.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CloseableThriftClient getCloseableClient()
      Retrieve an AutoCloseable wrapper around tx client for exclusive use by the current thread.
      void initialize()
      Initialize the provider.
      void returnClient(TransactionServiceThriftClient client)
      Release an tx client back to the provider's pool, if the client is valid.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize()
                throws org.apache.thrift.TException
        Initialize the provider. At this point, it should be verified that tx service is up and running and getClient() can create new clients when necessary.
        Throws:
        org.apache.thrift.TException

      • getCloseableClient

        CloseableThriftClient getCloseableClient()
                                         throws org.apache.thrift.TException,
                                                TimeoutException,
                                                InterruptedException
        Retrieve an AutoCloseable wrapper around tx client for exclusive use by the current thread. The client must be closed (returned) to the provider after use.
        Returns:
        an tx client, connected and fully functional
        Throws:
        org.apache.thrift.TException
        TimeoutException
        InterruptedException

      • returnClient

        void returnClient(TransactionServiceThriftClient client)
        Release an tx client back to the provider's pool, if the client is valid. If the client becomes disfunctional, for instance, due to a socket exception. The provider must make sure to close the client, and it must remove the client from its arsenal and be prepared to create a new client subsequently.
        Parameters:
        client - The client to return
